data.text: But she Or, reacheth from end onward unto end mightily  reacheth from one end of the world  to the other with full strength,
Her I loved and sought out from my youth,
She glorifieth her  noble birth in that it is given her to live with God,
For she is initiated into the knowledge of God,
But if riches are a desired possession in life,
And if understanding worketh,
And if a man loveth righteousness,
And if a man longeth even for much experience,
I determined therefore to take her unto me to live with me,
Because of her I shall have glory among multitudes,
I shall be found of a quick conceit when I give judgement,
When I am silent, they shall wait for me;
Because of her I shall have immortality,
I shall govern peoples,
Dread princes shall fear me when they hear of me:
When I am come into my house, I shall find rest with her;
When I considered these things in myself,
And in her friendship is good delight,
Now I was Or, a goodly child  a child of parts, and a good soul fell to my lot;
Nay rather, being good, I came into a body undefiled.
But perceiving that I could not otherwise This is the probable sense: the Greek text is perhaps defective.  possess wisdom  except God gave her  me
